text: James Douglas (Northwood Green, Middlesex 8 January 1870 – Cheltenham, Gloucestershire 8 February 1958) was an English first-class cricketer. Douglas was educated at Dulwich and Selwyn College, Cambridge. He was a right-handed batsman and a slow left-arm bowler for Cambridge University (three blues) and Middlesex. He came from a cricketing family. His brothers A.P., Robert and Sholto also played first-class cricket. ==References== ==External links== * Cricinfo * Cricket Archive Category:1870 births Category:1958 deaths Category:Cambridge University cricketers Category:English cricketers Category:Middlesex cricketers Category:People educated at Dulwich College Category:Alumni of Selwyn College, Cambridge Category:Gentlemen cricketers Category:Marylebone Cricket Club cricketers Category:C. title: James Douglas (cricketer)
